sample.description: OT-I mouse cytotoxic T lymphocyte attacking an ID8 cell
sample.protocol: High pressure freezing, freeze-substitution resin embedding with 2% OsO₄ 0.1% UA 3% H₂O in acetone; resin embedding in Eponate 12.
sample.contributions: Sample provided by Alex Ritter (Genentech), prepared for imaging by Gleb Shtengel (HHMI/Janelia), with imaging and post-processing by C. Shan Xu (HHMI/Janelia).

views.name: Default view
views.description: The default view of the data.

views.name: Cytotoxic T Lymphocytes cupping a cancel cell
views.description: A cytotoxic T Lymphocyte cupping the target ovarian cancer cell, as described in Fig. 3b of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Centrosome
views.description: The centrosome of a cytotoxic T Lymphocyte polarized toward the target ovarian cell, as described in Fig. 3c of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Lytic granule
views.description: The detailed structure of a lytic granule in a killer immune T cell, as described in Fig. 3d of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Membrane interdigitation
views.description: Membrane interdigitation of the interface between a cytotoxic T Lymphocyte and the target ovarian cancer cell, as described in Fig. S16a of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Flat membrane apposition
views.description: Flat membrane apposition of the interface between a cytotoxic T Lymphocyte and the target ovarian cancer cell, as described in Fig. S16b of Xu et al. 2020c.

views.name: Filopodia of a cancer cell
views.description: Filopodia of the target ovarian cancer cell trapped between a cytotoxic T Lymphocyte and the target cell, as described in Fig. S16c of Xu et al. 2020c.
